ThingDef.label: tomato cyst
ThingDef.description: Contrary to popular belief, these "tomatoes" are neither a vegetable or a fruit. These are actually cysts that grow on the back of a tomato frog. Their taste is indistinguishable from tomatoes.

ThingDef.label: spring peeper egg (unfert.)
ThingDef.description: An unfertilized chorus frog egg. Spring peeper frogs are engineered to lay eggs more than once a day, but they are not as nutritious as most eggs. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked.

ThingDef.label: spring peeper egg (fert.)
ThingDef.description: A fertilized chorus frog egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a spring peeper tadpole. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked.

ThingDef.label: bullfrog egg (unfert.)
ThingDef.description: An unfertilized bullfrog egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked.

ThingDef.label: bullfrog egg (fert.)
ThingDef.description: A fertilized bullfrog egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a bullfrog tadpole. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.

ThingDef.label: tomato frog egg (unfert.)
ThingDef.description: An unfertilized tomato frog egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Tastes like ketchup.

ThingDef.label: tomato frog egg (fert.)
ThingDef.description: A fertilized tomato frog egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a tomato frog tadpole. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked. It still takes like ketchup.

ThingDef.label: Grand Budgett's frog egg (unfert.)
ThingDef.description: An unfertilized Grand Budgett's frog egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked.

ThingDef.label: Grand Budgett's frog egg (fert.)
ThingDef.description: A fertilized Grand Budgett's frog egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a Grand Budgett's frog tadpole. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.

ThingDef.label: tree frog egg (unfert.)
ThingDef.description: An unfertilized bullet tree frog egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked.

ThingDef.label: tree frog egg (fert.)
ThingDef.description: A fertilized bullet tree frog egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a bullet tree frog tadpole. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.

ThingDef.label: poison dart frog egg (unfert.)
ThingDef.description: An unfertilized poison dart frog egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Unlike the frogs themselves, consumption bares no risk of food poisoning, let alone death.

ThingDef.label: poison dart frog egg (fert.)
ThingDef.description: A fertilized poison dart frog egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a poison dart frog. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked. Unlike the frogs themselves, consumption of this egg and the poison dart frog within bares no elevated risk of food poisoning, let alone death.
